author: Xyla Foxlin
description:
When I was 19, I built two internet-connected stuffed animals that could hug each other from anywhere in the world. 🧸❤️ One squeeze here, one buzz there — real haptic love over Wi-Fi. Nearly a decade later, I teamed up with Becky Stern (aka the internet’s electronics queen) to rebuild my “Perry Hug” project — this time with modern IoT hardware, smarter sensors, and fewer emotional breakdowns. It’s part engineering nostalgia, part open-source magic… and maybe the most wholesome tech story you’ll hear today.

Watch the full video to see how we made long-distance hugs real again.
